member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.NearFarClipDistance
member.summary: Clipping interval of the camera.
member.remarks: Parameter specifies two values - close and farther clip distance of visibility. The value of the close clipping, in addition to visibility, influences the distribution of values in the depth buffer. For best productivity, you need to aim to the minimum value of the farther view. For a better distribution in the depth buffer you need to aim to the maximum value near visibility.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.InitialCollisionBounds

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.CameraProjectionType
member.summary: The type of the camera. Allows you to choose from two options Perspective and Orthographic.
member.remarks: Perspective - the standard camera view. Appearance of the objects changes relative to the angle of view. Perspective Camera is a type of camera, which is similar to the camera in most 3D applications: it creates the prospect of three-dimensional images in the scene. Orthographic is a type of camera without perspective. Orthographic camera creates orthographic projection of the scene. It can be used to create direct projections (eg, top view or front) and axonometric projection. By using the CameraOrthoWindowHeight you can customize the height of the orthographic camera.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.CameraOrthoWindowHeight
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the orthographic camera type. See property CameraProjectionType for more information.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.StaticBatchingRenderingEnabled
member.summary: Enables static batching optimization for rendering static geometry. Static batching is the special optimization to reduce amount of draw calls on GPU. Static batching works only for StaticMesh objects.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.StaticBatchingPhysicsEnabledInMapEditor
member.summary: Enables static batching optimization for collision detection of static geometry in Map Editor. Static batching optimization is a unification of the physical bodies into large to reduce amount of bodies on the map. Static batching works only for StaticMesh objects.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.Map.StaticBatchingPhysicsEnabledInSimulation
member.summary: Enables static batching optimization for collision detection of static geometry in simulation (Game.exe). Static batching optimization is a unification of the physical bodies into large to reduce amount of bodies on the map. Static batching works only for StaticMesh objects.

member.summary: Type of physical material for determination of collisions. It allows to set up physical characteristics of a surface of object.
member.remarks: Besides the developer can add his own types of materials in the Data\Base\Constants\PhysicsSystem.config file.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.CollisionSpecialMeshName
member.summary: Allows you to override the original data of the 3D model when creating body for collision detection.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.CollisionVehicleDrivableSurface
member.summary: Allows you to use the body for collision detection as a surface for vehicles (cars).

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.RenderQueueGroup
member.summary: This parameter allows you to set the order of drawing opaque objects.
member.remarks: It specifies the position of an object in the queue rendering objects. Effects only the objects with opaque materials.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.TransparentObjectSortPriority
member.summary: This parameter allows you to set the order of drawing transparent objects.
member.remarks: It specifies the position of an object in the queue rendering objects. Effects only the objects with transparent materials.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.ForceMaterial
member.summary: Overrides materials of 3D model.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.SplitGeometry
member.summary: It allows you to cut the 3D model into parts automatically in order to optimize the rendering of the object on the screen.
member.remarks: This feature allows you to optimize the rendering due to the fact that unvisible parts of the cut 3D model will be quickly thrown out of the rendering process. This feature is useful for large objects such as terrain, buildings, rooms. Sizes of the parts are specified in the property SplitGeometryPieceSize.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.SplitGeometryPieceSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the pieces in the automatic cutting of the 3D model. See the description of the property SplitGeometry for more information.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.AllowDecals
member.summary: Allows to put decals on the geometry of 3D object model.
member.remarks: Decal is a geometry that overlaps the geometry of 3D models from other objects. Typical examples of decals may be drawing stains on the walls, traces of the explosions.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.CastDynamicShadows
member.summary: A value indicating whether the displaying shadows from 3D model of the object enabled.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.CastStaticShadows
member.summary: A value indicating whether the shadows from 3D model of the object in the process of calculating the static lighting enabled.
member.remarks: It is possible to set up static lighting using the manager of static lighting (Base/StaticLightingManager.type).

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.ReceiveStaticShadows
member.summary: Allows the application to the surface of the shadow static lighting.
member.remarks: A manager of static lighting is intended to configure static lighting (Base/StaticLightingManager.type).

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.RenderingDistance
member.summary: It is the maximum distance between the camera and the object after which the object is no longer rendered. A value of zero means that the visibility of the object will not be limited depending on the distance.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.RenderingDistanceForShadows
member.summary: It is the maximum distance between the camera and the object after which the shadows of the objects are no longer rendered. A value of zero means that the visibility of the shadows will not be limited depending on the distance.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.AllowStaticBatching
member.summary: A value indicating that the using of the static batching feature is allowed for this object. Static batching is the feature to improve rendering and physics performance. 1. Enables static batching optimization for rendering static geometry. Static batching is a special optimization that reduce the amount of draw calls on GPU. 2. Enables static batching optimization for collision detection of static geometry. Static batching optimization merges physical bodies into big tiles in order to reduce the amount of bodies on the map. To enable static batching feature see properties of Map object: Map.StaticBatchingRenderingEnabled, Map.StaticBatchingPhysicsEnabledInMapEditor, Map.StaticBatchingPhysicsEnabledInSimulation.

member.name: P:Engine.MapSystem.StaticMesh.AllowGeometryInstancing
member.summary: A value indicating that the using Hardware Geometry Instancing feature is allowed for this object. Hardware Geometry Instancing is the special optimization to reduce amount of draw calls on GPU.
